request_pathways.name: Authorization for Use or Disclosure of Health Information
Mail to Garfield Medical Center HIM

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient must use a generic HIPAA authorization form designed for all releases, selecting 'Personal Use' as the purpose and filling in their own name as the recipient.

red_flags: CD liability waiver bundled into general authorization â€” patients must waive liability for CD release even when not requesting imaging
Revocation of authorization limited to postal mail only
bright_spots: Email delivery option with dedicated email address field
Inspect or Review Medical Record option alongside copies
Granular record type selection with 12+ specific categories

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic web search; direct PDF links returned without login or bot blocking. Minor deduction for duplicate forms at different URLs creating potential confusion.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Digitally-created PDF with text layer is usable but has zero fillable fields, requiring print-and-handwrite workflow; fax and email submission are available, providing electronic submission options.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized 2-page form with clear section headers, logical flow, and granular record type options; minor issues include intimidating opening warning and unexplained legal code references.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the form by selecting 'Personal Use' purpose, but it was not designed for patient self-access; the framing is third-party release and patients must figure out which parts apply to them.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Correctly states treatment non-conditionality and includes notice of rights, but bundles a CD liability waiver into the general authorization and discloses fees without amounts, going somewhat beyond what the law requires for patient access.

overall.summary: Garfield Medical Center provides an easy-to-find, well-organized authorization form with useful features like email delivery and record type granularity, but the generic third-party release framing, non-fillable PDF, bundled liability waiver, and lack of a dedicated patient access pathway keep it at average quality.
